meanings.definition: To cause to feel completely exhausted or worn out.
meanings.sent1: After running a marathon, the race completely frazzled me.
meanings.sent2: The long day of work left me feeling frazzled and tired.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle too many tasks at once can frazzle even the most organized person.
meanings.sent4: The constant demands of the job frazzled her nerves like a frayed rope.
meanings.sent5: The intense heat and humidity frazzled my energy, leaving me drained.

meanings.definition: To become completely exhausted or worn out.
meanings.sent1: After the intense workout, I was frazzling from head to toe.
meanings.sent2: The long hike up the mountain frazzled my muscles.
meanings.sent3: Staying up all night studying for the exam left me frazzled and sleepy.
meanings.sent4: The non-stop dancing at the party frazzled my energy like a worn-out battery.
meanings.sent5: The long road trip frazzled my body, making me crave a good night's sleep.

meanings.definition: To make someone feel nervous or anxious.
meanings.sent1: The unexpected news about the test frazzled me before the exam.
meanings.sent2: The suspenseful movie had me frazzling in my seat.
meanings.sent3: The thought of speaking in front of a large crowd frazzled her nerves.
meanings.sent4: The looming deadline for the project frazzled my mind like a tangled web.
meanings.sent5: The dark alley at night frazzled her senses, making her heart race.

meanings.sent1: As the deadline approached, I could feel myself frazzling with worry.
meanings.sent2: The upcoming presentation had me frazzling about every little detail.
meanings.sent3: The spooky stories around the campfire had the kids frazzling with excitement.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence in the haunted house had me frazzling like a leaf in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The sudden thunderstorm frazzled the picnic attendees, sending them scrambling for cover.
